text:
Hello Everyone! I need some help here. 

I had submitted an expression of interest for the Digital Infrastructure Incubator at Code for Science and Society. My proposal was about extending and revising the R dev guide and working on its outreach during the Incubator. 

So, yesterday I gave the initial screening interview and have received some feedback from them. I will share the feedback points in a thread with this message. 

I am asked to modify my expression of interest based on this initial feedback and submit it again by September 10. Then, they would assess my expression of interest one more time to decide whether it is fit to be a part of the Incubator.

The idea is to identify and focus on a priority challenge which could be solved during the Incubator (with deliverables that are sustainable). I would really appreciate any inputs that you have.

elements.text:
Hello Everyone! I need some help here. 

I had submitted an expression of interest for the Digital Infrastructure Incubator at Code for Science and Society. My proposal was about extending and revising the R dev guide and working on its outreach during the Incubator. 

So, yesterday I gave the initial screening interview and have received some feedback from them. I will share the feedback points in a thread with this message. 

I am asked to modify my expression of interest based on this initial feedback and submit it again by September 10. Then, they would assess my expression of interest one more time to decide whether it is fit to be a part of the Incubator.

The idea is to identify and focus on a priority challenge which could be solved during the Incubator (with deliverables that are sustainable). I would really appreciate any inputs that you have.

text: Feedback points from the initial screening interview:

elements.text: Feedback points from the initial screening interview:

text:
1. There are several layers of work that can be done on this project/guide, and it is recommended that I focus on only one of them for this incubator program.
2. I identified the main challenge of this work as the outreach of this guide. So the feedback was that the outreach challenge could be an entire project in itself for this program. If outreach is the priority, then I should modify my expression of interest accordingly. Say, orient it towards improving the community healthy, diversity issues, to name a few. I don't need to have a plan ready with me at this stage, as to how am I going to solve this challenge. This plan will be made during the project, through discussions.
3. Another challenge identified was the governance of the R Contribution Working Group (RCWG). This could also be an independent project, with the deliverable that maybe we setup a steering committee for the RCWG.
4. The project should be more focused on doing the invisible work of connecting humans to the guide instead of working on the building the guide itself. Modifying/building the guide further could be a by-product but it should not be the main task during the incubator. The incubator is mainly designed to help improve the processes of human connections with a tech project.
5. This is one report that I am asked to refer: <https://www.fordfoundation.org/work/learning/research-reports/roads-and-bridges-the-unseen-labor-behind-our-digital-infrastructure/|https://www.fordfoundation.org/work/learning/research-reports/roads-and-bridges-the-unseen-labor-behind-our-digital-infrastructure/>

attachments.title: Roads and Bridges: The Unseen Labor Behind Our Digital Infrastructure
attachments.text: Society runs on software but software building tools are buckling under the demand. In this report,
attachments.fallback: Ford Foundation: Roads and Bridges: The Unseen Labor Behind Our Digital Infrastructure

elements.text: There are several layers of work that can be done on this project/guide, and it is recommended that I focus on only one of them for this incubator program.

I identified the main challenge of this work as the outreach of this guide. So the feedback was that the outreach challenge could be an entire project in itself for this program. If outreach is the priority, then I should modify my expression of interest accordingly. Say, orient it towards improving the community healthy, diversity issues, to name a few. I don't need to have a plan ready with me at this stage, as to how am I going to solve this challenge. This plan will be made during the project, through discussions.

Another challenge identified was the governance of the R Contribution Working Group (RCWG). This could also be an independent project, with the deliverable that maybe we setup a steering committee for the RCWG.

The project should be more focused on doing the invisible work of connecting humans to the guide instead of working on the building the guide itself. Modifying/building the guide further could be a by-product but it should not be the main task during the incubator. The incubator is mainly designed to help improve the processes of human connections with a tech project.

text: So I am asked to decide what is the priority task that could be done during the incubator. Also they are flexible with getting inputs from the RCWG.

text: Which challenge should we prioritise to solve during the incubator (if selected)? Any inputs?
